turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. Good morning.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello, good morning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I'm Doctor <UNSURE>Deen Mirza</UNSURE> from GP at Hand. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Before we start your appointment, could you please tell me your first name and your date of birth.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes. Uh, my name is John Smith. And I was born on the fifth of April, uh, nineteen seventy three.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, that's great. Thank you for that. Um, are you in a private place where you're OK to speak freely?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes. <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>, OK, great. OK, so um, tell me a bit about what's been happening? <UNSURE>You said</UNSURE> you mentioned in the notes that <UNSURE>you've</UNSURE> got a problem with your elbow.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. Um, I just noticed this like about a week ago, or something? Um, have like a weird swelling on, on, on my elbow.  I noticed that when I was in the shower. Uh,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's not painful at all, or like, I <UNIN/> I feel fine. But it's just, just a bit, a bit weird, to see that.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's, it's slightly warm. Um, and I, I, cannot feel like this, little bit fluid in inside, or, uh, um?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, sure. <UNIN/>, and <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So, I, I like to know what's going on with <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, and so, did you say it was the left elbow or the right elbow?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's the, the left <UNIN/> elbow.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Left elbow, OK. <UNIN/>, and have you banged that elbow? Do you have any kind of injury?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, not really. Um, not that I know of. I haven't noticed anything. I can actually like move it normally. Um, it's just, I <UNIN/>, I can just see that. It feels a bit strange, a bit

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. <UNIN/>, and um, <UNIN/>, in terms of your job, do you do anything physical?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not really. No, I just, you know sit at a desk. Um, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right. OK. <UNIN/>, and um, has this happened before?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no I haven't noticed that before. Um, I don't have any like history of, of seeing this. I don't remember <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. Uh, and can I um, can I just double-check? Has anyone in your family, got any, kind of rheumatology, diseases, like rheumatoid arthritis, or lupus or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, well I, I do, well I think, I think I have something like uh, osteoarthritis. Um,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, uh, it sometimes kind of hurts, uh, my joints. But uh, in my family, I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. <UNIN/>, so you know you said you think you've got <UNIN/>, uh, osteoarthritis. Has anyone ever told you that? Have you ever seen a doctor who's confirmed that, and told you you've got osteoarthritis?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yes. Yes, a few years ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/>, was that a GP or a specialist or, was it, a <UNSURE>physiotherapist</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> a <UNIN/> a GP. Um, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: GP, OK, all right. Um, look can I just, uh, sorry can I just double-check how old you are please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm uh, fifty three.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fifty three, OK. Fantastic. All right. Um, and, do you have any other illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well not, not really, no. Um, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> I'm, I'm allergic to, to peanuts. Um, but that's, that's pretty much all I uh, have to say about my medical history, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, <UNSURE>are you</UNSURE>, are, are you allergic to any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. Not that I know of.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. <UNIN/>, and um, do you um, are you on any medication on a regular basis?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK.  And are you normally fit and well? Mobile and active?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> yeah. I do, I do, I do some sports. I run regularly, like two, three times a week. Um, yeah, no, I'm, think I'm healthy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, good, good, glad to hear. Well done that's <UNIN/>, it's good that you're doing that on a regular basis. OK. Um, and um, uh, can I, is it possible for me to have a look at your elbow, now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, <UNSURE>sure</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, good, bear with me one second.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And if you can just raise your elbow up a little bit like that, a bit higher, so I can just see the underside. OK, fantastic, all right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And then, just, bring it round to this side, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, I can see other side. OK, fantastic. All right. And if you can just touch the tip of your elbow with your fingers.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: There's, <UNIN/>, is it, is it hot, compared to the surrounding skin, the adjacent skin?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's a bit warm, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It's a bit warmer. OK. Um, and um, is it very tender when you're pressing on that nerve? Is it, if you, if you give it a press, does it hurt you at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: On the, on the tip of the elbow, it's, it's OK, just like, next to it like where the, the swelling is, it's a bit, yeah it feels <UNSURE>weird</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. All right. Um, well, um, I noticed the skin was a bit dry, <UNIN/>, on the tip of the elbow. Do you, do you have dry skin anywhere else on the body?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no not really. I have <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> <UNSURE> skin really dry</UNSURE> now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, <UNSURE>do you</UNSURE> <UNIN/>, do you suffer from eczema at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. Alright.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So um, what I think we should do, with regards to your elbow problem

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Is um, I think, it would be worthwhile. <UNIN/>, this seems like uh, what we call the Bursitis. OK. So, that's an inflammation of one of the fluid sacs around the joint.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, what I think we should do is, I think you should be on some anti-inflammatory medication, in the, in the first instance.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, as well as that, what I would like to do, is to get some blood tests done, to check for other types of uh, causes of joint swelling. K?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Alright</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, um, what we're going to do is, we're going to arrange some, um, blood test forms to be sent out to your house. And, there'll be instructions within that pack, about where to go to get those blood tests done.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, that will involve you, um, having some tests done to check for inflammatory markers, infection, rheumatological antibodies.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So we'll do a full screen, and also check for things like Gout as well, OK. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The time frame for that, will be um, the results will come back to us after about five <UNSURE>or</UNSURE> six days. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: K <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. O

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: From now, but it may take time for the form to come out to you. And if you get the form get the blood tests done straight away, by the time that we're expecting result back, you know one or two days after that, we're looking maybe six days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, what I would suggest, is, we can arrange a follow-up appointment for you, in one of our clinics, where we can have a look at your joint, feel it, we can review the blood test.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, we can um, get a gauge as to, uh, what's going on. Now in terms of your joint right now,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It doesn't look like, to me that's something called, excuse me, septic arthritis. So, we're worried sometimes that someone might have an acutely infected joint.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and uh, your, your joint doesn't look like that.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: However, if your, the elbow was to become very red, very painful, uh, and the redness was to spread or become uh, you know more intense. Then you need to get on the phone or get, have a video appointment <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, with one of us as soon as possible.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: 'Cause that would be an emergency. That would require more immediate assessment, more immediate treatment. OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/> do you, do you think it's something dangerous? Like something, like could I die from that, or is it, is it

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No. I, I don't think this is anything dangerous. <UNIN/> don't need to worry. OK? What I'm doing, is I'm just outlining the worst case scenario if things were to, to <UNSURE>develop</UNSURE>. K? So, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, this, this is not the case right now. Right now, it looks quite straightforward.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, OK, I see.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>It's</UNSURE> nothing <UNIN/>, sinister or life-threatening. Um, what I'm doing is I'm just saying, in case things worsen, these are the things that we'd be looking out for, and this is what we have to do. But you don't have that now, thankfully, and I don't think you're going to have it.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But I'm just saying, the what if scenario. Is that OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah that, that sounds good. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Did you have any questions that you wanted to ask me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, well just yeah <UNIN/> I just wanted to know about this. Um, yeah it feels a bit better now <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Uh, but yeah, no that's it. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, I, I would take Ibuprofen regularly, OK. You can get that <UNIN/>, over the counter. Um, that's four hundred milligrams, two times a day. And you should take, take that after food, not on an empty stomach. If you get any heartburn, stop taking it. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure. <UNIN/> thanks. <UNSURE>Bye</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. So, what I wanna do is, I'll get the <UNSURE>forms</UNSURE> sent out to you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, um, we are going to arrange a, a follow-up appointment.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Maybe within a um, actually you know, the follow-up appointment doesn't have to be face-to-face, if it's more convenient for you do, to do it over the phone, we can do that over the phone, uh, over video. We can do that as well, that's, that's your call. But you contact us, <UNIN/>, after you've had the blood test done, and we can review things then, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, yeah that sounds good. I, I'll do that. And if I see that it's getting worse, I'll probably ask for a physical appointment.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, sure that's a good idea. All right then, OK. Um, take care then. So <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>look</UNSURE> just leave that with me, I'll sort all those bits and pieces out, and then we'll get them sent out to you, and then we'll, we'll um, review you after the tests, things goes well, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thank you. Alright. Sounds

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right <UNSURE>then</UNSURE>. Take care then, all the best. Bye bye.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Bye.
